entries.question: Why are you asking me to signup/login with Twitter?
entries.answer:
Security and Friction.
I don't want to hack together some homebrew login system and then have the information of all 13 users of this site get compromised.
In today's hyperconnected global economy who has the time to spend signing up with an email/password for a website?
Most people who come to this site will probably do so via Twitter.
If for whatever reason this site blows up, I'll consider adding other Single Sign On options.

entries.question: What kind of access do you have to my Twitter account?
entries.answer:
Read Only.

This permission level permits read access to Twitter resources, including (for example) a user's Tweets, home timeline, and profile information.
It does not allow access to read a user's Direct Messages.

from Twitter's developer site
